title: Harrowing 911 call from parents attempting CPR on son, 8, after he overdosed on heroin
text:
News Harrowing 911 call from parents attempting CPR on son, 8, after he overdosed on heroin Charles Dowdy and Danielle Simkio, both 31, have now been charged with drug possession and child endangerment after drugs were found in toy watch hidden in boy's sock Share Get daily   
This is the harrowing 911 call made by two parents are their eight-year-old son overdosed on heroin . 
Charles Dowdy and Danielle Simkio, both 31, have been charged with drug possession and child endangerment, according to Cleveland.com . 
They were arrested after their son was taken to hospital and staff found prescription pills and heroin in his sock. 
In the clip, Dowdy speaks to the operator, saying: "For some reason my son is not breathing. 
"He's hurting. Please hurry." Charles Dowdy called 911 after his son stopped breathing (Photo: Cuyahoga County Jail) Danielle Simko was also arrested (Photo: Cuyahoga County Jail) 
He then shouts over to his partner, desperately trying to convince her that their son isn't breathing. 
The emergency call operator then talks Dowdy through CPR, where he describes his son as making "gurgling noises". 
The couple were in bed with their son in their home in Berea, Ohio, when they noticed their son had stopped breathing and his lips had turned blue. Charles Dowdy admitted to using drugs in the house earlier in the day (Photo: Cuyahoga County Jail) 
During the 911 call, he tells the dispatcher: "I think he was sleeping and I think what happened was he rolled over and I donâ€™t think he could breathe. I think he was just, like, in the pillow and he suffocated." 
Dowdy also told the operator that their son was seven, even though medical records prove his is eight. 
When paramedics arrived, they immediately took the boy to the Southwest General Medical Center where a urine test suggested he had heroin in his system The couple are due to appear in court tomorrow (Photo: Cuyahoga County Jail) 
The drugs were found inside a toy watch that had been hidden in the boy's sock. Read More 
When police questioned the couple, Dowdy admitted to using drugs in the house earlier in the day. The pair were arrested at the hospital. Charles Dowdy and Danielle Simko's home on Milton Street (Photo: Google Maps) 
The parents were held in custody after the incident on January 11. 
Their eight-year-old son is in the custody of relatives, and both Dowdy and Simkio have been banned from contacting him. 
They are scheduled to appear in court tomorrow, February 22. Like us on Facebook
